title.native: THE GOD OF HIGH SCHOOL ゴッド・オブ・ハイスクール

description:
It all began as a fighting tournament to seek out for the best fighter among all high school students in Korea. Mori Jin, a Taekwondo specialist and a high school student, soon learns that there is something much greater beneath the stage of the tournament.

(Source: WEBTOONS)

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Rotoscoping
tags.description: Animation technique that animators use to trace over motion picture footage, frame by frame, to produce realistic action.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Calligraphy
tags.description: Centers around the art of calligraphy.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

title.native: 갓 오브 하이스쿨

alternative: The Youngest Member of The Six

node.description: __Education:__ Sunchon National University

Aspired to become an animator when he saw [Macross: Do You Remember Love?](https://anilist.co/anime/1089/), while in elementary school. He studied art in middle school and high school, and later enrolled to a university with an animation department. There he was set on either moving to the United States or Japan to study abroad, and ended up choosing Japan due to how popular hand-drawn animation was there. After moving to Japan and graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology and Arts, he joined [Studio Comet](https://anilist.co/studio/126/) in 2005 and began his career in the industry.

He later joined [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) after getting scouted out by the studio's founder, [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/).

Debuted as a director in 2017 with [Garo: Vanishing Line](https://anilist.co/anime/99796/).

In March 2021 he established the [E&H Production](https://anilist.co/studio/7229) studio becoming its Representative.
Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
Representative director of Raretrick.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kisuke_j6)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/katsu_nak)

Affiliated with Sound Box.

[Website](https://www.tateki.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TatekiKobayashi)

Tateki Kobayashi is a singer-songwriter, lyricist, composer, and music producer. Graduated from Kindai University.

[Twitter (Alisa Okehazama)](https://twitter.com/aliiisa_ok) | [Twitter (Alisa Fukami)](https://twitter.com/alisa_024) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/%E6%A1%B6%E7%8B%AD%E9%96%93%E3%81%82%E3%82%8A%E3%81%95-100315608634523/) | [SoundCloud (Alisa Fukami)](https://soundcloud.com/alisafukami) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6VMGyvtQPQ1uPvkaSm73aR?si=NT2wdnG2Sy60driRfdIQdw) | [AppleMusic](https://music.apple.com/jp/artist/alisa-okehazama/1548614368) | [Blog](https://profiee.com/i/alisa_oke) | [Weibo](http://weibo.com/okehazama)

Alisa Okehazama, alternatively known as Alisa Fukami is a Japanese composer and arranger
Ami Kutsuna is a color designer and digital painter.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialtc) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialtc/)__

__Tyler Carter__, alternatively known by birth name Derek Tyler Carter, is an American vocalist, lyricist and member of the metalcore band [Issues](https://twitter.com/issues).

[Website](https://ksukejpn.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KSUKE_JPN) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ksuke_jpn/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOkBDyVdBKneSKUMX5HT4cA/featured) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/ksuke_jpn) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6MXOcf1IlhzpV0b8qtjAzd?si=RH347AYFSKu6dd1JpWDMgg)

KSUKE, alternatively known as DANGER×DEER, is a Japanese DJ, music producer and member of five-piece rock band [cottelee](https://www.cottelee.com/profile).

__[Website (Korean)](http://c9ent.co.kr/c9boyz/) | [Website (Japan)](https://cix-official.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cix_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/cix.official/)__

__Introduction:__
CIX, alternatively known as Complete in X, is a five member South Korean boy band under record label Warner Music Korea, formed and managed by C9 Entertainment.

__Members:__
- Byung-Gon Lee (이병곤, イ・ビョンゴン), better known by stage name  BX (비엑스) – leader, main rapper
- Seung-Hun Kim (김승훈, キム・スンフン), better known by stage name Seunghun (승훈, スンフン) – main vocalist
- Yong-Hee Kim (김용희, キム・ヨンヒ), better known by stage name Yonghee (용희, ヨンヒ) – vocalist
- Jin-Young Bae (배진영, ベ・ジニョン) – lead vocalist, lead dancer
- Hyun-Suk Yoon (윤현석, ユン・ヒョンソク), better known by stage name Hyunsuk (현석, ヒョンソク) – vocalist, rapper, main dancer

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialtc) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialtc/)__

__Tyler Carter__, alternatively known by birth name Derek Tyler Carter, is an American vocalist, lyricist and member of the metalcore band [Issues](https://twitter.com/issues).

[Website](https://ksukejpn.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KSUKE_JPN) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ksuke_jpn/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOkBDyVdBKneSKUMX5HT4cA/featured) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/ksuke_jpn) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6MXOcf1IlhzpV0b8qtjAzd?si=RH347AYFSKu6dd1JpWDMgg)

KSUKE, alternatively known as DANGER×DEER, is a Japanese DJ, music producer and member of five-piece rock band [cottelee](https://www.cottelee.com/profile).

__[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jamilmusicjp/)__

__Introduction:__
Jamil Kazmi, born as Jamil Jamik Kazmi, is an American vocalist and lyricist. 

__Biography:__
He moved to Japan for school, but eventually found himself pursuing his music career instead. Having worked with the likes of Metis, Futoshi (Aqua Timez), Nesian Mystik, Wise (Teriyaki Boyz), and Speech (Arrested Development), JAMIL finally released his debut album “American Shounen” in August 2011

__[Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/addymaxwell)__

__Birthplace:__ Atlanta, Georgia, USA

__Addy Maxwell__ is an American rapper and lyricist.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/thehourglasslee)__

__Lee Rouse__ is an American producer and lyricist.

__Birthplace:__ Atlanta, Georgia, USA

__Jaten Dimsdale__, born as Jaten Collin Dimsdale, is an American vocalist, lyricist and member of the rock band WildHeart.

__Birthplace:__ Atlanta, Georgia, USA

__Jonathan Litten__ is an American writer and professor at Southwestern Academy.

Aspired to become an animator when he saw [Macross: Do You Remember Love?](https://anilist.co/anime/1089/), while in elementary school. He studied art in middle school and high school, and later enrolled to a university with an animation department. There he was set on either moving to the United States or Japan to study abroad, and ended up choosing Japan due to how popular hand-drawn animation was there. After moving to Japan and graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology and Arts, he joined [Studio Comet](https://anilist.co/studio/126/) in 2005 and began his career in the industry.

He later joined [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) after getting scouted out by the studio's founder, [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/).

Debuted as a director in 2017 with [Garo: Vanishing Line](https://anilist.co/anime/99796/).

In March 2021 he established the [E&H Production](https://anilist.co/studio/7229) studio becoming its Representative.
